DOC.HEAD: Journal of Commerce Announces Management Changes
DOC.TEXT: The editor and the general manager of The Journal of Commerce will trade jobs, it was announced Monday. Robert L. Harris, general manager of the Journal since 1987, will become editor of the newspaper; Stanford Erickson, editor for the past three years, will become general manager. The changes, which take effect Jan. 1, were announced by Don C. Becker, president and publisher of the paper. He said the purpose of the move was ``to further invigorate the organization while providing new challenges to some highly deserving individuals.'' Harris, 53, was editor of Crain's New York Business before joining the Journal. Erickson, 50, was vice president of public relations for the Sea-Land Corp. before joining the paper. The Journal, owned by Knight-Ridder Inc., publishes Monday through Friday.
